title: shap.plots.bar do not have 'plot_size' argument
body:
Hi, if one wants to plot shap plots on subplots, he should set `show=False, plot_size=None` in plotting function, e.g.:

```python
# The secret in the `show=False, plot_size=None` part
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(16, 20))
ax = plt.subplot(121)
shap.summary_plot(shap_values_1, train_x, plot_type="bar", show=False, plot_size=None)
ax.set_title('title 1')

ax = plt.subplot(122)
shap.summary_plot(shap_values_2, train_x, plot_type="bar", show=False, plot_size=None)
ax.set_title('title 2')
```

But `shap.plots.bar(shap_values, show=False, plot_size=None)` throws error:
> TypeError: bar() got an unexpected keyword argument 'plot_size'

The `shap.summary_plot(shap_values, show=False, plot_type='bar')` is a bad substitution, because it gives different plot

Thus, at the moment, there is no way to plot correct shap bar plot on a subplot.

### Examples

`shap.plots.bar(shap_values, show=False)`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2557965/119836165-2b2ed600-bf0a-11eb-9a6b-0a1906814d0e.png)

`shap.summary_plot(shap_values, show=False, plot_type='bar')`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2557965/119836184-308c2080-bf0a-11eb-9532-6913f15a9997.png)
